text.base: The body lies in the center of the clearing, not encased in ice, but *blooming* with it. Translucent, recursive structures look like ferns made of glass, growing out of the skin. There is no smell of decay. Only the smell of ozone and wet wool.

lens.skeptic: Paradoxical undressing hypothesis rejected; clothes are intact. Frostbite patterns are inconsistent with environmental exposure. The crystallization follows the lymphatic system. It looks... cultivated.
lens.believer: Not a victim. A chrysalis. The heat isn't life; it's the energy of transformation. Don't touch the glass. It will grow on you too.
lens.haunted: You recognize the coat. You recognize the way the hand is curled. It's him. It's always him. And he's still warm.

inserts.text: Your thermal scanner whines. ERROR. Target saturation. Core temp: 102.4°F and rising. It's a fever in a dead thing. A biological impossibility.

victim.description: The face is peaceful. Too peaceful. The frost has formed a perfect, crystalline mask over the features.

interactions.touch: The crystal vibrates against your glove. A high-pitched frequency that you feel in your teeth.

board_updates.label: Impossible Heat
board_updates.description: The frozen body has a core temperature of 102.4°F.

on_success.text: You make an incision. No blood. Just clear, viscous fluid that freezes instantly upon contact with the air. The internal organs are gone. Replaced by a geode of blue ice.

on_fail.text: Your hand shakes. You nick the frozen skin. The sound it makes is like a bell ringing. You pull back, nauseous.
